title: As it happened - State of the Union - BBC News
summary: us president barack obama has given his annual state of the union speech .
his annual address to congress included plans to raise taxes on the wealthy .
but the republicans , who now control congress , have voiced opposition to many of his proposals .
an official republican response , delivered by iowa senator joni ernst , followed mr obama 's speech .

documents.title: good night
text: thank you for joining our live coverage of the 2015 state of the union .
our coverage will continue on bbc.com/news and on @ twitterid

the silver lining of the sotu is that at least once a year president obama is forced to actually speak with members of congress .

@ twitterid well of course there 's that .
back to the real world tomorrow .
we do n't know how many americans watched tonight , but the longer a presidency goes on the fewer people tend to tune in .
barack obama 's first speech attracted 52.3 million viewers .
only 33.3 million watched on television last year , according to the nielsen ratings .
bill clinton bucked this trend when his 1998 state of the union attracted more eyeballs , but that was at the height of the monica lewinsky scandal .
george w bush saw spikes in the audience in 2002 in the aftermath of the attacks of september 11th and 2003 , his famed axis of evil speech , when he laid out the case for the invasion of iraq .
author: Nick Bryant
BBC News, New York

documents.title: 'i ploughed the fields '
text: like many responses , ms ernst begins with some of her personal history - `` as a young girl , i ploughed the fields of our family farm .
i worked construction with my dad .
to save for college , i worked the morning biscuit line at hardees . ''

joni ernst begin the republican response - `` i 'd like to have a conversation about the new republican congress you just elected , and how we plan to make washington focus on your concerns again . ''
`` we heard the message you sent in november - loud and clear .
and now we 're getting to work to change the direction washington has been taking our country . ''

documents.title: 'brighter future '
text: mr obama finishes his speech by saying `` we too are a strong , tight-knit family .
we , too , have made it through some hard times . ''
`` fifteen years into this new century , we have ourselves up , dusted ourselves off , and begun again the work of remaking america .
we 've laid a new foundation .
a brighter future is ours to write . ''
steny hoyer keeping obama in check : throughout speech , every camera cut to him has him reading what appears to be transcript of speech # sotu
author: Suzanne Kianpour
BBC News, Washington

text: he 's now coming to the end of his speech , returning to the theme of unity .

`` i want future generations to know that we are a people who see our differences as a great gift , that we are a people who value the dignity and worth of every citizen - man and woman , young and old , black and white , latino and asian , immigrant and native american , gay and straight , americans with mental illness or physical disability . ''

documents.title: gay marriage
text: `` i 've seen something like gay marriage go from a wedge issue used to drive us apart to a story of freedom across our country , a civil right now legal in states that seven in ten americans call home , '' mr obama says .
the us supreme court will take up that question even more broadly when they rule on whether state marriage bans are constitution .

documents.title: struggling on
text: one of those struggling to get by on low wages is rosetta kreisel from tucson , arizona .
she has lived at the sleepy hollow trailer park for 19 years .
`` i got divorced when my children were young so i always worked , '' she told bbc pop up 's anna bressanin .
`` i never dreamed that things would be so hard .
i always thought you save your money and you make things work , but it somehow did n't work for me . ''
you can watch @
mr obama calls for community college to become `` as free and universal in america as high school is today '' .
in the us , high school is the final four years of us primary education , usually done during the ages of 14-18 .
a partial view of the house standing and applauding .

documents.title: childcare surprise
text: a tax-cut for childcare of up to $ 3,000 per year per child has just been announced - this was not among the `` spoilers '' mr obama previewed in the last few weeks .

mr obama goes on : `` middle-class economics means helping working families feel more secure in a world of constant change .

that means helping folks afford childcare , college , health care , a home , retirement - and my budget will address each of these issues , lowering the taxes of working families and putting thousands of dollars back into their pockets each year . ''

`` tonight , we turn the page , '' says the president , referring to the momentous events that characterised the first 15 years of the new century - the recession , two wars involving us troops and 9/11 .
the vice-president and house speaker are always behind the president when he delivers this address .
now come the handshakes , the hugs and the kisses as the president slowly makes his way through the throng .

the president enters the house chamber .

text: one of the guests at the state of the union will be ana zamora , a 20-year-old college student from dallas .
she was invited after writing a letter to the president last year highlighting how her parents came to this country from mexico .
she told me she feels ecstatic and thrilled to listen to the president 's speech tonight .

ms zamora benefited from the president 's deferred action for childhood arrivals programme ( daca ) in 2012 , and her parents are among the millions of people who could potentially apply to the immigration measures announced in november .
author: Thomas Sparrow, BBC Mundo

text: marketplace 's david gura

documents.title: and on tv elsewhere
text: while most of american television will be commandeered by the state of union address tonight , president obama wo n't be on every channel .
the real housewives of beverly hills will premiere a new episode on bravo .
meanwhile , iowa and wisconsin will face off in men 's collegiate basketball on espn and bbc america will air a classic episode of star trek : the next generation .
recent polls show obama 's approval ratings have been edging toward net-positive for the first time since his re-election .

documents.title: designated 'survivor '
text: us transportation secretary anthony foxx - the former mayor of charlotte , north carolina - is the cabinet official who will spend this year 's state of the union address in an `` undisclosed location '' , in case he needs to assume control of the government in the event of a catastrophic attack on the us capitol .

documents.title: rocky times
text: the middle class squeeze is even being felt in the liberal bastion of boulder , colorado , on the edge of the rocky mountains , as
a tech boom , combined with strict planning laws designed to stop urban sprawl , has sent housing prices soaring over the past decade .
confronted by deepening wage inequality and an affordable housing crisis , residents are now debating what values are most important to them .
it appears a key theme of this speech will be economic inequality - the wall street journal shares a number of graphs that

given the intricate stage-management of modern-day state of the unions , it is remarkable to recall the moment in 1994 when bill clinton realised the wrong speech had been loaded into his teleprompter .
`` i am not sure what speech is in the teleprompter tonight , '' he said at the outset , `` but i hope we can talk about the state of the union . ''
he winged it for the rest of the speech .
author: Nick Bryant
BBC News, New York

text: the chicago tribune 's steve chapman writes that the state of the union speech is a relic of the past that should be abandoned .
`` if there was ever a time that direct exposure to presidential eloquence could melt the hearts of hostile legislators , it has passed , ''
author: Anthony Zurcher
Editor, Echo Chambers

mrs ernst is also expected to outline areas where republicans and mr obama can `` work together '' including trade deals and tax reform .
the republican response will also call for a `` comprehensive plan '' to defeat terror groups .

documents.title: 'stale mindset '
text: in excerpts of the republican response , senator joni ernst argues that , amid tough economic times , `` too often washington responded with the same stale mindset that led to failed policies like obamacare .
it 's a mindset that gave us political talking points , not a serious solution '' .
mr obama will also call for congress to pass cyber-security legislation .

documents.title: war against is
text: also in the selections of the speech released by the white house - mr obama will call for a `` use of force '' authorisation against the islamic state militant group .
it is unclear what this means beyond the current air strike campaign against is in iraq and syria .
george washington delivered the first state of the union speech , not in washington but new york , the then provisional capital , on january 8th , 1790 .
the venue was federal hall on wall street .
thomas jefferson ( seen below ) , that great presidential wordsmith , abandoned the practice , preferring to deliver his annual report to congress in writing rather than in person .
it was too regal , he deemed , too much like the british monarch 's `` speech from the throne . ''
author: Nick Bryant
BBC News, New York

text: another guest is undocumented student ana zamora , who was a beneficiary of mr obama 's 2012 immigration executive action .
mr obama expanded the programme last year and , as pri the world reports ,

documents.title: special guests
text: mr obama is expected to highlight some of those people who have written to him , by inviting them to share a seat near first lady michelle obama in the house gallery .
here 's

documents.title: changing faces
text: what 's changed in six years ?
the bbc 's anthony zurcher takes a look at how these annual speeches reveal the rising and falling fortunes of the

documents.title: 'fair share '
text: `` in fact , at every moment of economic change throughout our history , this country has taken bold action to adapt to new circumstances , and to make sure everyone gets a fair shot , '' mr obama is expected to say .

`` we set up worker protections , social security , medicare , and medicaid to protect ourselves from the harshest adversity that 's what middle-class economics is - the idea that this country does best when everyone gets their fair shot , everyone does their fair share , and everyone plays by the same set of rules . ''

documents.title: 'middle class economics '
text: the white house has released a few excerpts of this evening 's speech .
from these selections there appears to be a clear focus on policies which aim to decrease economic inequality .
mr obama will call for more policies of `` middle class economics '' , according to released excerpts .
it was not until 1913 that woodrow wilson began the modern-day tradition of appearing before congress to deliver a speech , a move that stunned washington .
jimmy carter was the last president to deliver a written report , once in 1981 as he prepared to leave the white house .
author: Nick Bryant
BBC News, New York

documents.title: spoiler alert
text: the us president has made no secret of what he plans to propose - in fact he 's travelled the country making speeches about different elements , from free community college to methane reduction .
here are

documents.title: spotlight on ernst
text: immediately after the president finishes , republicans will broadcast a rebuttal speech .
this year 's speaker is freshman iowa senator joni ernst , seen here rehearsing .
mr obama will begin speaking at 21:00 est ( 02:00 gmt ) and is expected to speak for about an hour .

documents.title: speech an option
text: it 's a
but it does not have to be a speech .

such addresses were unheard of until the 20th century , and since the 1980s , a president has given a state of the union speech every year to a joint session of congress as well as a televised audience .
the stage is set for a night of political theatre in washington , dc .
welcome to our live page coverage of the 2015 state of the union address .
